page.title: 09THE CHURCHILL NEWSLETTER
page.content: "Roundabout", the village news sheet first appeared in February 1970. Written and duplicated on a hand-operated duplicator by the village schoolteacher and distributed by her to every householder, she wrote that she would produce two more issues, and if the village liked it, they should raise the money to continue publication. This they have done ever since. Today, the editor writes the copy; it is typed onto a stencil by another villager; it is taken into Chipping Norton's Primary School to be duplicated, and is then distributed by seven people to every house in Churchill, Sarsden and Merriscourt, with twenty-five copies going by post to outlying parishioners. It is free and appears ten times a year.
